comments:
To reproduce the bug, with Eclipse 3.1.2 and WTP 1.0.1:
1) Create a dynamic web project.
2) Create a new WSDL file (in the WebContent folder), with "Create WSDL Skeleton" flag checked, SOAP protocol, document literal as SOAP binding.
3) Open the file in "Graph view".
4) Enter the type editor double clicking on the types url.
5) Right click on the "Types" panel, select "add complex type".
6) In the "Properties" view, select the "Attributes" tab.
7) Right click on the Properties panel, in order to add a new xml attribute.

Right clicking does nothing, and I get this exception in the Error Log:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.WSDLEditor
	at org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.XSDMenuListener.isSchemaReadOnly(XSDMenuListener.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.XSDMenuListener.updateXSDSchema(XSDMenuListener.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.wst.xsd.ui.internal.properties.section.AttributesViewSection$AttributeTableTreeViewer$XSDAttributeMenuListener.menuAboutToShow(AttributesViewSection.java:225)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.fireAboutToShow(MenuManager.java:285)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.handleAboutToShow(MenuManager.java:372)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager.access$0(MenuManager.java:369)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.MenuManager$2.menuShown(MenuManager.java:386)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:117)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:843)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:867)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:848)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.WM_INITMENUPOPUP(Control.java:3337)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.windowProc(Control.java:3064)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Decorations.windowProc(Decorations.java:1582)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.windowProc(Display.java:3751)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.TrackPopupMenu(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Menu._setVisible(Menu.java:225)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runPopups(Display.java:3151)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2752)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1699)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1663)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:143)

	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)

Of course, if needed I can supply more detail, if someone tells me how to get them. Could someone please verify I'm not alone incurring in this problem?

Thank you,

Fabio Da Soghe

Attributes are now added via an Extensions Tab in the Properties view.  Currently there is an issue where adding a new attribute does not update the Extensions Tab to show the newly added attribute:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=170826

thanks.
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
